questions.question_text_1: In a linear power supply, the series pass element (e.g., a BJT) is primarily responsible for dissipating power as heat. For a given load, what is this power dissipation directly proportional to?
question_texts: In a linear power supply, the series pass element (e.g., a BJT) is primarily responsible for dissipating power as heat. For a given load, what is this power dissipation directly proportional to?

questions.question_text_1: In a bridge rectifier feeding a constant load, increasing the value of the filter capacitor
question_texts: In a bridge rectifier feeding a constant load, increasing the value of the filter capacitor

options.option_text: decreases the peak current through the diodes
increases the peak current through the diodes
changes the shape of the diode currents without altering their peak value
does not affect the diode currents

questions.question_text_1: Compared to a half-wave rectifier with the same capacitor and load resistor, what is the key difference of a full-wave rectifier with a capacitor filter regarding output ripple?
question_texts: Compared to a half-wave rectifier with the same capacitor and load resistor, what is the key difference of a full-wave rectifier with a capacitor filter regarding output ripple?

options.option_text: The ripple frequency is doubled, and the ripple amplitude is lesser
The ripple frequency is halved, and the ripple amplitude is doubled .

questions.question_text_1: If you have to decide between 2 similar rated MOSFETs (Voltage rating and current rating are the same), that are made by 2 different manufacturers solely based on thermal resistance, you would choose the MOSFET with __________ and thus the temperature rise in the device for the same current flowing would be ____________
question_texts: If you have to decide between 2 similar rated MOSFETs (Voltage rating and current rating are the same), that are made by 2 different manufacturers solely based on thermal resistance, you would choose the MOSFET with __________ and thus the temperature rise in the device for the same current flowing would be ____________

questions.question_text_1: In a flyback converter the switching frequency is 20 kHz with a duty ratio of 75%. The input voltage is 15 V and the output voltage is 45 V. The load current is 1 A. What is the voltage withstanding capability of the diode D.
questions.question_text_2: In a flyback converter the switching frequency is 20 kHz with a duty ratio of 75%. The input voltage is 15 V and the output voltage is 45 V. The load current is 1 A. What is the voltage withstanding capability of the diode D.
question_texts:
In a flyback converter the switching frequency is 20 kHz with a duty ratio of 75%. The input voltage is 15 V and the output voltage is 45 V. The load current is 1 A. What is the voltage withstanding capability of the diode D.

questions.question_text_1: A Linear regulator Datasheet is attached in the main data: Linear Regulator Datasheet 1) Typical output voltage of LM7812 at 25oC is W volts. 2) Maximum input voltage that can be applied before the device damages is X volts. 3) The junction to case (top) thermal resistance of LM7805 for DCY package is Y oC/W 4) The minimum input voltage required to maintain line regulation for LM7815 is Z volts. W+X+Y+Z=

questions.question_text_1: A Linear regulator Datasheet is attached in the main data: Linear Regulator Datasheet If the device package for LM7815 is selected as TO-220, then what is the maximum average power dissipation (in Watts) at 35oC ambient that is allowed if a heat sink with thermal resistance 10oC/W is used?

questions.question_text_1: The current limiting circuit is given below that can limit the load current. The maximum current that can be handled by the load safely is 10A. What is the minimum power rating (in Watts) of the resistor Rs. (Assume all the transistors have same characteristics, VBE=0.8V).
